title: Teenager on ‘girly weekend’ among three stabbed at Arndale Centre
text:
Chloe McGurk, 19, from Northern Ireland, has been named as one of the victims of the Arndale Centre attack (Picture: John Greenhalgh)

A teenager on a weekend away has been named locally as one of the three stabbing victims at the Arndale Centre.

A man in his 40s was arrested on suspicion of terror offences and detained under the Mental Health Act after three people were stabbed and two hurt at the Manchester shopping centre on Friday morning.

Chloe McGurk, 19, from Northern Ireland, was in Manchester ‘for a girly weekend’ with a group of friends when the knifeman struck.

Her friend Ellen Da Conceicao wrote on Facebook: ‘All we wanted to do was come over to Manchester for a girly weekend, but instead the first shopping centre we step into this happens.

‘We’re all so shaken and can’t for the life of us understand how someone could be so low to do this to our Chloe and other victims.

Advertisement

‘I can’t get that man’s face and knife out of my head and probably won’t for a very long time. Chloe is on the mend and thanks everyone for their support.’

On social media, it was confirmed that the Arndale Centre had reopened today with an increased police presence to assure the safety of shoppers.

Chloe was on a ‘girly’ weekend away with her friends when she was stabbed

A post from the Manchester Arndale Twitter account said: ‘We can now confirm that we will be reopening tomorrow. We would like to thank Greater Manchester Police and the other emergency services for their amazing support.

‘Over the coming days, there will be an increased Police presence in the centre to provide reassurance. The safety of our shoppers and staff is always our absolute priority.’

Another post from Pat Karney, a Councillor for Harpurhey and Collyhurst, said that a sign had been put up that read: ‘MCR is open. We love MRC’.

Both posts received widespread support on Twitter, with people on social media heralding the ‘unique Manchester spirit’.

Jacque Allen commented saying ‘Let’s all go shopping today and show our support for the amazing city that is Manchester. I love MCR’, while Charlie Norman added: Our unique Manchester spirit is so special’.

Officers continue to investigate ‘in order to fully understand the motives behind the attack’, which happened when the suspect entered the Exchange Court area of the centre at 11.15am on Friday.

The Arndale Centre reopened today (Picture: Pat Karney/Twitter)

Witness told the MailOnline that it was ‘like something out of a horror film’, with shoppers running in panic, shouting ‘knife’ and ‘bomb’, as police and paramedics raced to the scene.

Advertisement

Advertisement

One witness said: ‘I heard a woman scream. I span around and saw this guy who had a knife in his hand.

‘It looked like he had stabbed her back. There was blood pouring from her and she just fell to the floor.

‘As soon as I saw the knife I just ran as fast as I could and was warning others what happened.

‘Everyone was looking down from the first floor and there was real panic, people screaming.

‘The police were there in minutes and then we were evacuated. It was like a nightmare. Like something out of a horror film.

‘It was awful. I can’t get that image out of my head.’

A man in his 40s has been detained under the Mental Health Act (Picture: John Greenhalgh)

The suspect was detained by armed officers within five minutes in nearby Corporation Street at the side of Marks & Spencer.

A man in his 50s, a woman, 19, and another woman were rushed to hospital with stab wounds, but none of the injuries are thought to be life-threatening.

The suspect was arrested on suspicion of assault and then re-arrested on suspicion of commission, preparation and instigation of an act of terrorism.

Police later said he had been detained under the Mental Health Act, following an assessment ‘by specialist doctors’.

Assistant chief constable Russ Jackson, of Greater Manchester Police, said: ‘We do not know the motivation for this terrible attack.

‘It appears random, is certainly brutal and of course extremely frightening for anyone who witnessed it.

‘At this time we do not believe that there is anyone else involved in this attack but we will be constantly keeping this under review.

‘We have specially trained officers supporting those injured from the attack.

‘We’ll have increased patrols, including armed patrols, in the city centre this weekend.’

He appealed for anyone who was in the Arndale at the time to send any images or footage taken from the scene via the force’s website.
